skill.author: AmemiyaLai

security_audit.summary: Legitimate Grasshopper workflow automation tool. All 527 static findings are false positives: C2 keywords are UUIDs in GUID mappings, external_commands are Ruby code examples in documentation, and weak crypto patterns are references in documentation. The tool communicates via TCP with local MCP server on port 8080, reads/writes JSON and MMD files within project directories only, and has no external network calls or data exfiltration.

content.value_statement: Creating Grasshopper definitions manually is time-consuming and repetitive. This skill enables AI assistants to programmatically create components, establish connections, and execute complete parametric modeling workflows through the MCP protocol, turning design specifications into working Grasshopper definitions automatically.
actual_capabilities: Create, query, and delete Grasshopper components via MCP protocol
Establish connections between components with parameter mapping
Set Number Slider and Vector XYZ component parameters
Parse MMD files to extract components, connections, and subgraphs
Generate and execute placement_info.json workflow files
Batch create component groups with custom colors
limitations: Requires a running Grasshopper MCP server on localhost:8080
Cannot modify existing Grasshopper definitions directly
Only supports components with known GUIDs in the built-in mapping
Connection parameters must be specified manually

use_cases.title: Automate design iteration
use_cases.description: Convert design specifications into Grasshopper definitions automatically for rapid design iteration

use_cases.title: Batch component placement
use_cases.description: Create complex component networks from MMD files with parallel execution for efficiency

use_cases.title: Enable Claude for CAD work
use_cases.description: Add Grasshopper control capabilities to AI assistants for parametric design assistance

prompt_templates.title: Create simple component
prompt_templates.scenario: Add a Number Slider to Grasshopper
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Number Slider at position x=100, y=200 with component_id SLIDER_WIDTH, then set its value to 120.0 with range 0-200

prompt_templates.title: Connect components
prompt_templates.prompt: Connect SLIDER_WIDTH to DIVISION_X using source param Number and target param A

prompt_templates.title: Execute full workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Parse component_info.mmd, generate placement_info.json, then execute it with 10 parallel workers

prompt_templates.title: Batch group creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create groups for desktop components and leg components using the parsed subgraph information with color #FF0000

output_examples.input: Parse component_info.mmd and show me the components found

best_practices: Use component_id keys for better readability instead of raw component IDs
Set max_workers between 10-20 for parallel execution to balance speed and stability
Save component ID mapping after creation to preserve state for subsequent operations
anti_patterns: Do not attempt to create components without specifying valid GUIDs from the mapping
Avoid connecting components without specifying the correct source and target parameters
Do not skip GUID updates when using placement_info.json from different Grasshopper versions

faq.question: What is the MCP server requirement?
faq.answer: A Grasshopper MCP server must be running on localhost:port 8080. This skill connects to it via TCP sockets.

faq.question: What file formats are supported?
faq.answer: MMD files for component definitions and JSON files for placement instructions and component ID mappings.

faq.question: How do I integrate with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Install this skill and use the provided functions to interact with Grasshopper. The skill exposes all operations through MCP tool definitions.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. All communication is local to your machine. No data is sent externally. File operations stay within the project directory.

faq.question: Why are connections failing?
faq.answer: Check that all source components exist, the component ID mapping is saved, and you have specified correct parameter names.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual Grasshopper work?
faq.answer: This skill automates repetitive tasks. You design in MMD format once, then the skill creates all components and connections automatically.
